comment.text: works fine on Processors: 8 × Intel® Core™ i7-3632QM CPU @ 2.20GHz Memory: 15.4 GiB of RAM Graphics Processor: Mesa DRI Intel® HD Graphics 4000 no regressions.
Works fine on kvm/qemu/virt-manager

Looks ok for me. Works on baremetal (non UEFI mode) AMD Ryzen5 3600, Mainboard MSI B450M Mortar Max with prop. nvidia driver from rpmfusion.org (GTX980 card). Works with Gnome-Desktop (Xorg). Regression test passed (paxtest, selinux-dac-controls and libhugetlbfs skipped).
Default & performance tests pass (KVM)

Works for me: desktop 16GB Intel i7-3770 CPU & laptop 8GB Intel i5-2520M CPU Lenovo T420 (the desktop ran the performance test in 10m13s -- but the laptop took 106m0s, about 10 times longer) - all using the Mate Desktop Environment.

[[[  In kernel-5.13.13-200.fc34 the laptop was actually slightly faster than the desktop!  ]]]
Worked fine.
i7-9700K(UHD Graphics 630): kernel regression test passed. Works fine for daily use.
Default & performance tests pass (KVM)
On a VMware VM 5.13.15 and 5.13.16 get stuck at "A start job is running for /dev/mapper/fedora_fedora-root (NNmin NNs / no limit)". 5.13.14 and earlier work as expected.
HP Probook G7 same thing like other kernels bigger than 5.11, blank laptop display but hdmi works. Tested with nvidia videocard and with intel videocard (after disabling nvidia from bios)

long_desc.thetext:
A race condition was discovered in ext4_write_inline_data_end in fs/ext4/inline.c in the ext4 subsystem in the Linux kernel through 5.13.13.

Upstream Issue:

https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/tytso/ext4.git/commit/?id=9e445093e523f3277081314c864f708fd4bd34aa

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2001952]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Reproducers, if any, will remain confidential and never be made public, unless done so by the security team.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=high

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2001951,2001952

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
FEDORA-2021-4ca1b080bb has been submitted as an update to Fedora 34. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2021-4ca1b080bb
FEDORA-2021-60f1d2eba1 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 33. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2021-60f1d2eba1

FEDORA-2021-4ca1b080bb has been pushed to the Fedora 34 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --advisory=FEDORA-2021-4ca1b080bb`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2021-4ca1b080bb

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-2021-60f1d2eba1 has been pushed to the Fedora 33 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --advisory=FEDORA-2021-60f1d2eba1`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2021-60f1d2eba1

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-2021-4ca1b080bb has been pushed to the Fedora 34 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

FEDORA-2021-60f1d2eba1 has been pushed to the Fedora 33 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.
